definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Then, the wave catches the surfboard and pulls it and the surfer toward the shore.
sentences.chinese: 接著大浪会涌向滑板，将滑板与冲浪者推往海岸。

sentences.english: Surfers look for a good spot at Bondi Beach.
sentences.chinese: 冲浪者寻找在邦迪海滩一个好的地点。

sentences.english: Attempting to force the shark to release him, the surfer slugged it on the snout over and over.
sentences.chinese: 冲浪者不断重击它的鼻子，试图让白鲨放开他。

sentences.english: Typically, people surf the Web by clicking on links to get more information.
sentences.chinese: 通常，网上冲浪者通过单击链接来获取更多的信息。

sentences.english: There are numerous legends and stories about courageous local surfers.
sentences.chinese: 有很多关于勇敢的当地冲浪者的传说和故事。

sentences.english: The island is called Ada Bojana, and the area is quickly becoming a party destination for the young surfer set.
sentences.chinese: 现在这个海岛在年轻冲浪者中迅速走热。

sentences.english: Surfers on main beach, heading out.
sentences.chinese: 沙滩上正准备出发的冲浪者。

sentences.english: Yet, some live for interacting with its unpredictable motions; they are surfers.
sentences.chinese: 冲浪者就是同海洋不可预知的运动进行交互。

sentences.english: The surfer surfed in the sea yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 冲浪者昨天在海里冲浪。

definition: stand-up paddleboarding (SUP)/stand-up paddleboard/blade of a propeller/blade of an oar
to dive/to go under water/(in an online forum) to lurk
